item.title: Onboarding on AI Safety
item.description: I am working on activation steering with Nina Rimsky and Arjun Panickssery. You can follow the progress here. Feel free to leave suggestions or words of encouragement here.

item.title: Formal meditation practice
item.description: Working towards easily accessing the first Jhanna states. Teachers: Rob Burbea, Jhourney Team. I meditate 2 hours/day and review the sessions here. Prev experience: Vipassana retreats (Goenka, 2021/UK, 2022/USA, would love to sit the third), the realization process with Judith Blacksmith, etc. Suggestions? DM me on twitter If you have worked through the first jhannas and have suggestions, I’ll open the doc for comments. I love Rob Burbea teachings, if you think I’d appreciate a different teaching or practice, feel free to share.

item.title: General Wellbeing
item.description: Sleep plenty and wake up without an alarm. Eat wholesome food Exercise and body work (I love massages) Meditate Note: The house that I live in with the lovely aussies in my life are supportive of these behaviours.

item.title: Date me doc
item.description: The doc has been archived and is now used as a “hello, nice to meet you” note. Here are other artifacts of me on the internet here

item.title: [Book] Negotiation by Chriss Voss
item.description: I. Principles of negotiation Negotiation was seen as a zero-sum game for a long time. The goal was to get as much out of the interaction as possible – but always at your opponent’s expense. Your counterpart was your enemy, and the negotiation was a battle. The adversary is not the person across the table; the adversary is the situation. The person across the table is your negotiating partner – that you can work with against the situation, so that you are both better off.

item.title: [Book] How confidence works by Ian Roberts
item.description: What is confidence? Optimism, hope and self-esteem can be confused with confidence. They differ in one fundamental way, confidence empowers action. The future in uncertain. Confidence is a mental stance towards the future that defies the uncertainty by betting on success. 4 types of confidence: can’t do/can’t happen; can do/can’t happen; can’t do/can happen; can do/can happen. How Confidence Works Lack of confidence often arises because goals are not clear and attention is not sharply focused on them.

item.title: [Book] GIRL POWER by Sheryl Sandberg
item.description: IMPORTANT NOTE: All of us, myself included, are biased, whether we admit it or not. And thinking that we are objective can actually make this even worse, creating what social scientists call a “bias blind spot.” This blind spot causes people to be too confident about their own powers of objectivity so that they fail to correct for bias. The leadership ambition gap, what would you do if you weren’t afraid A recent survey of Millenials found that women were just as likely to describe themselves as ambitious as men.

item.title: [Draft][Book] Habits by James Clear
item.description: Resources https://jamesclear.com/atomic-habits/resources https://s3.amazonaws.com/jamesclear/Atomic+Habits/Habits+Cheat+Sheet.pdf Make it obvious Fill out the Habits Scorecard. Write down your current habits to become aware of them. Templates I will ___________[action] at _________ [time] in ____________ [location] After __________ [current habit], I wil ___________ [new habit] Design your environment. Make the cues of good habits obvious and visible. 1.2 1.3 1.4 Make It attractive Use temptation bundling. Pair an action you want to do with an action you need to do.

item.title: How to get an offer from FAANG?
item.description: I interviewed a lot in my short work experience and I got rejected. And I got offers. Google, Amazon, DeepMind, Facebook, Bloomberg, Skyscanner, JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley. I compiled here all the advice that I give to my friends when they ask or when they don’t ask.\ What you need to know? Data structures and algorithms. Only one subject out of the entire Computer Science degree. You also need to know the time and space complexity of every data structure.
